channel.title: Journal on Alex Again
channel.description: Recent content in Journal on Alex Again

item.title: Who Are You and What are You Doing Here?
item.description:
The child of immigrant parents.

The spouse of a vagabond, learning to grow roots.

A former vagabond myself. (What does it take to have a Home?)

Filled with wonder and hope.

A parent of a young child.

What are you reminded of?

A patchwork quilt.

A discarded toy.

A bridge.

A stray dog.

A still pond.

A raging sea.

An alpine flower.

A ripening papaya.

I aspire to be more like the sun.

item.title: Introversion is Overrated
item.description:
I would call myself naturally more introverted.

I used to spend hours happily writing inside my private notebooks, never opening up to others about the deep things.

But, introspection can only get you so far.

You’re too close to yourself. You can’t see the lenses and models you use to make sense of the world because you’re too busy seeing with them.

You can’t examine a pair of glasses while you’re wearing them.
